intro: Stipecoma peltigera, commonly known as the peltate stipe, is a lichen species belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, peltate thallus structure, which forms a flattened, leaf-like body. The plant typically grows on bark, rocks, or soil in temperate and subtropical regions. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role. Stipecoma peltigera is often used in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
